Which version of pango are you running ?
Please past here the output of the command:
rpm -q gtk2 glib2 pango freetype

In my system I haev:
-sh-2.05b$ rpm -q gtk2 glib2 pango freetype

pango-1.1.1-1

# rpm -q gtk2 glib2 pango freetype

you will need to update your freetype library. let me know if this fixes the 
problem, thanks.

Gil, roll back your changes and try to install the package using the command:
rpm -Uvh freetype-2.1.2-7.i386.rpm

let me know if this help, it means you can install the package nicely.

If you update the freetype and the problem doesn't go away try to update pango 
too.

Note, I've this same problem in past and I've fixed it updating my libs. 

In my system I have:
-sh-2.05b$ rpm -qa *freetype*
freetype-demos-2.1.2-7
freetype-2.1.2-7
freetype-devel-2.1.2-7
freetype-utils-2.1.2-7

Althought i have installed the correct libraries indicated here 
http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%7Echeckout%7E/platform-swt-home/fa
q.html#gtkstartup for eclipse 2.1, I still get a java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError
fot FT_Seek_Stream, I believe because in the new freetype2.1 package (included
in xfree4.3) some functions have been renamed, including FT_Seek_Stream that
became FT_Stream_Seek.
Bye

Gil, can you verify if freetype2 is now include in package xf86 (version 4.3) ? 
it doesn't seen quite right.

The information I gave to you in this PR are RedHat related, I'm sorry if I 
have caused any confusion. But I just realize that in Suse there are two 
freetype packages, freetype and freetype2.
Here is my freetype version:
fheidric@lswtsuse:~> rpm -q freetype
freetype-1.3.1-656
fheidric@lswtsuse:~> rpm -q freetype2
freetype2-2.0.9-75


I can run eclipse with the following configuration:
fheidric@lswtsuse:~> rpm -q xf86 gtk2 glib2 atk pango freetype2
xf86-4.2.0-176
gtk2-2.0.6-51
glib2-2.0.6-29
atk-1.0.3-45
pango-1.0.4-46
freetype2-2.0.9-75

Sorry for the delay in responding - fun with projects on this side ...

I did something that is well, pretty inadvisable and went ahead to update some
of the libraries mentioned below. I did an ole "rpm --nodeps --force -Uhv" with
the following packages ...

56459 Apr  5 16:01 atk-1.0.3-64.i586.rpm* 
390723 Apr  5 16:02 freetype2-2.0.9-84.i586.rpm* 
284733 Apr  5 16:00 glib2-2.0.6-45.i586.rpm* 
1252647 Apr  5 15:59 gtk2-2.0.6-71.i586.rpm* 
329958 Apr  5 16:02 pango-1.0.4-66.i586.rpm* 
20586862 Apr  5 16:00 xf86-4.2.0-187.i586.rpm* 

- X86 didn't like this idea so much so the server now sits in a perpetual state
of x-hang - after boot on xserver startup. I can go back in and play with
versions and such but since it is a spare machine that I am continuely reimaging
- it might just be better to start from the start.

Funny thing is, the problem that prompted this bug is now gone ...
<aside>
the mainboard on my t30 was replaced by ibm tech and immediately after the
xserver just kept shutting down - the tech said that there might be a videocard
variation and I figgured I should just go to 4.3 xfree86 anyway - which fixed
the problem but it seemed to hose some of gnome along with eclipse. 

Thinking that the error in eclipse might be something the project was interested
in I opened the bug - rolled back my original machine and created the scratch
machine. I eventually fixed the xserver crash by turning off that peskey
hardware cursor - what caused it to work fine one minute and not the next I do
not know - but now I have a nice-n-stable t30 with xfree 4.2 and SuSE 8.1 with a
working eclipse. :)

I am going to try SuSE 8.2 sometime next week, which seems to have xfree 4.3 and
other goodies - so I will let you know how that goes. 
</aside> 

Thanks very much for the attention - it is greatly appreciated - and let me know
if you are interested in my trial of 8.2.

Best Regards,

-g.

Absolutely, please let me know if Eclipse runs okay on SuSE 8.2.
We'll close this problem report once you have Eclipse running on SuSE 8.2/XFree 
4.3.
Thanks
Hi Gil, did you update to SuSE 8.1 ? I heard that SuSE 8.2 is now available.

Whoa - that was a little bit weird - as I read that email someone just handed me
the 8.2 box. I'll give it a try right away.
Hi Gil, is this bug fixed in SuSE 8.2 ?
My BAD! It has been working on 8.2 and very stable!
